channel.title: ObjectHandler Error

item.title: ObjectHandler Error
item.dc:creator: @KempiScape KempiScape
item.description:
@KempiScape wrote:

[quote=“TeeBark, post:17, topic:463593”][quote author=KempiScape link=topic=567126.msg4121751#msg4121751 date=1349820156]
we are getting some where now, i said put it above but tilly was correct.

the new error just means variable hatId does not exists
int hatId1 = player.getEquipment().getHatId();
change to
int hatId = player.getEquipment().getHatId();


[/quote]

Thanks a ton bro, been working at this for days lol. Had a getplane error afterwards but fixed that.

Thanks again :)[/quote]

If you need more help you can pm me your skype if you have it, im bored lol

Read full topic

item.title: ObjectHandler Error
item.dc:creator: @TeeBark TeeBark
item.description:
@TeeBark wrote:

[quote=“KempiScape, post:10, topic:463593”]public Player player;

wrong location

put it above the method[/quote]

Where would I move it to?

I changed it to this:

[code] else if (id == 2488)
Runecrafting.craftEssence(player, 560, 65, 10, true);
else if (id == 30624)
Runecrafting.craftEssence(player, 565, 77, 10.5, true);

public Player player;
			else if (id == 2452) {
				int hatId1 = player.getEquipment().getHatId();
				if (hatId == Runecrafting.AIR_TIARA
						|| hatId == Runecrafting.OMNI_TIARA)
					Runecrafting.enterAirAltar(player);[/code]

Got 2 errors:

src\com\rs\net\decoders\handlers\ObjectHandler.java:329: error: illegal start of expression public Player player; ^ src\com\rs\net\decoders\handlers\ObjectHandler.java:330: error: 'else' without ' if' else if (id == 2452) { ^ 2 errors Press any key to continue . . .

Read full topic

item.title: ObjectHandler Error
item.dc:creator: @Sir_Jay Sir Jay
item.description:
@Sir_Jay wrote:

[quote=“TeeBark, post:5, topic:463593”][quote author=Sir Jay link=topic=567126.msg4121568#msg4121568 date=1349804321]
It is what it is. It is an illegal start of an expression. If you knew the basics of Java then you would know how to fix this error my friend.
[/quote]

Instead of bitching, help a guy out?[/quote]

Nobody is bitching and if you took my advice you would thank me for it.

Read full topic

item.title: ObjectHandler Error
item.dc:creator: @TeeBark TeeBark
item.description:
@TeeBark wrote:

[quote=“EvoIllusions, post:2, topic:463593”]Try;
public Player (player);[/quote]

Nope.

src\com\rs\net\decoders\handlers\ObjectHandler.java:335: error: illegal start of expression public Player (player); ^ 1 error Press any key to continue . . .

[code]src\com\rs\net\decoders\handlers\ObjectHandler.java:335: error: illegal start of
expression
private Player (player);

                                                    ^

1 error
Press any key to continue . . .[/code]

Would it perhaps be because the other tiaras don’t have the public player player at all, but only this one does?

Read full topic

item.title: ObjectHandler Error
item.dc:creator: @TeeBark TeeBark
item.description:
@TeeBark wrote:

Hey,

I’m getting this error in ObjectHandler:

src\com\rs\net\decoders\handlers\ObjectHandler.java:335: error: illegal start of expression public Player player; ^ 1 error Press any key to continue . . .

The code around it is:

else if (id == 2485) Runecrafting.craftEssence(player, 563, 50, 9.5, true); else if (id == 2488) Runecrafting.craftEssence(player, 560, 65, 10, true); else if (id == 30624) Runecrafting.craftEssence(player, 565, 77, 10.5, true); else if (id == 2452) { int hatId1 = player.getEquipment().getHatId(); if (hatId == Runecrafting.AIR_TIARA || hatId == Runecrafting.OMNI_TIARA) Runecrafting.enterAirAltar(player); } else if (id == 2455) { int hatId1 = player.getEquipment().getHatId(); public Player player; if (hatId == Runecrafting.EARTH_TIARA || hatId == Runecrafting.OMNI_TIARA) Runecrafting.enterEarthAltar(player); } else if (id == 2456) { int hatId = player.getEquipment().getHatId(); if (hatId == Runecrafting.FIRE_TIARA || hatId == Runecrafting.OMNI_TIARA) Runecrafting.enterFireAltar(player); } else if (id == 2454) { int hatId1 = player.getEquipment().getHatId(); if (hatId == Runecrafting.WATER_TIARA || hatId == Runecrafting.OMNI_TIARA)

I’ve tried changing the “public Player player;” to:
“private Player player;”
“public Player player,”
“private Player player,”

If anyone can help, it’d be appreciated.

Thanks.

Read full topic
